page.title: 18FARM LIVESTOCK _ TILMANSTONE
page.content: Livestock on Tilmanstone farms is {beef cattle}and{breeding sheep.}There were until recently{dairy herds.}Some farmers have{horses}on their land, but these are for domestic use and not part of the working farm. Beef{cattle}are{slaughtered}at 18 months to{2 years old.} {Lambs}are sent for{slaughter}at around{6 months,}with carcases weigh_ ing roughly{15 kilos. Producers are awarded a{quality {premium}if the carcase is of accept_ able{size}and{leanness,}thus control_ ling quality from the farmers. There has been great controversy over recent plans to instal a{lairage on the outskirts of the village. Residents are against the plan due to {increased traffic}day and night, and {distress}caused to the{animals.}The problem was unresolved in late 1985.
